text: Excess of grief for the dead is madness for it is an injury to the living, and the dead know it not.
author: Xenophon

text: A creative element is surely present in all great systems, and it does not seem possible that all sympathy or fundamental attitudes of will can be entirely eliminated from any human philosophy.
author: Morris Raphael Cohen

text: If you suppress grief too much, it can well redouble.
author: Moliere

text: I have the greatest sympathy with the growth of the socialist party. I think they understand the evils that surround us and hammer them into people's minds better than we Liberals.
author: Charles Trevelyan

text: They weren't impatient for the boys to turn into cartoons again. They awarded sympathy, gave compassion. Because deep down they had found parts of themselves in the characters. You said it George.
author: Audrey Meadows

text: I have nothing but sympathy for the people who are forced to work with me. I'm better now at picking out those that want to play that game with me, and those that don't.
author: Alton Brown

text: Grief is a normal and natural response to loss. It is originally an unlearned feeling process. Keeping grief inside increases your pain.
author: Anne Grant

text: I belong to a nation which over the past centuries has experienced many hardships and reverses. The world reacted with silence or with mere sympathy when Polish frontiers were crossed by invading armies and the sovereign state had to succumb to brutal force.
author: Lech Walesa

text: Sympathy is the first condition of criticism.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

text: I have great sympathy for people that are infertile, but a life is not something you can give away.
author: Mary Beth Whitehead

text: Whether rich people make money or lose money, they get no sympathy from the public.
author: Gary Ackerman

text: Women ought to feel a peculiar sympathy in the colored man's wrong, for, like him, she has been accused of mental inferiority, and denied the privileges of a liberal education.
author: Angelina Grimke

text: Recognition of belligerency as an expression of sympathy is all very well.
author: Henry Cabot Lodge

text: I can hardly express in words my deep feeling and sympathy for them, knowing as I do, the many serious handicaps and obstacles that will confront them in almost every walk of life.
author: Major Taylor

text: If there was less sympathy in the world, there would be less trouble in the world.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: I never ask for mercy and seek no one's sympathy.
author: Conrad Black

text: I have to have a character worth caring about. I tend not to start writing books about people I don't have a lot of sympathy for because I'm just going to be with them too long.
author: Richard Russo

text: My mother listened to all the news from the camp during the strike. She said little, especially when my father or the men who worked for him were about I remember her instinctive and unhesitating sympathy for the miners.
author: Agnes Smedley

text: Badges mean nothing in themselves, but they mark a certain achievement and they are a link between the rich and the poor. For when one girl sees a badge on a sister Scout's arm, if that girl has won the same badge, it at once awakens an interest and sympathy between them.
author: Juliette Gordon Low

text: You have to have sympathy for and an empathy with a character in order to play them.
author: Laura Carmichael

text: Children require guidance and sympathy far more than instruction.
author: Anne Sullivan

text: Criticism in the universities, I'll have to admit, has entered a phase where I am totally out of sympathy with 95% of what goes on. It's Stalinism without Stalin.
author: Harold Bloom

text: Here bring your wounded hearts, here tell your anguish Earth has no sorrow that Heaven cannot heal.
author: Thomas More

text: I want the municipality to be a helping hand to the man with a desire of sympathy, to help the fallen when it is not in their power to help themselves.
author: John Burns

text: I didn't feel any remorse or sympathy if I injured a rival. I went over the top a few times but I never broke anyone's leg.
author: Peter Storey

text: I have sometimes been wildly, despairingly, acutely miserable, racked with sorrow, but through it all I still know quite certainly that just to be alive is a grand thing.
author: Agatha Christie

text: I think we lost a great deal of sympathy and support with the way in which the crisis was handled, most importantly I think when we appeared to be grasping for too much at one time instead of identifying our priorities in a much more responsible fashion.
author: Billy Tauzin

text: More negatives write than call. It's a cheap shot for me to go on the air with the critical letters or E-mail I get because the reaction of the listeners is always an instantaneous expression of sympathy for me and contempt for the poor critic.
author: John Hall

text: To desire and expect nothing for oneself and to have profound sympathy for others is genuine holiness.
author: Ivan Turgenev

text: I'm not looking for sympathy at all.
author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

text: I have a theory because I was being beaten up a lot by people outside of school, it was almost like if I could make myself sick enough they'd take sympathy on me.
author: Daniel Johns

text: Here's my rule: You always want to pay cash for your own books, because if they look at the name on the credit card and then they look at the name on the book jacket, then there's this look of such profound sympathy for you that you had to resort to this. It really is withering.
author: Carl Hiaasen

text: It is by a wise economy of nature that those who suffer without change, and whom no one can help, become uninteresting. Yet so it may happen that those who need sympathy the most often attract it the least.
author: F. H. Bradley

text: IT is mere coincidence that Cooper was born in the year which produced The Power of Sympathy and that when he died Uncle Tom's Cabin was passing through its serial stage, and yet the limits of his life mark almost exactly the first great period of American fiction.
author: Carl Clinton Van Doren

text: But what you could perhaps do with in these days is a word of most sincere sympathy. Your movement is carried internally by so strong a truth and necessity that victory in one form or another cannot elude you for long.
author: Hjalmar Schacht

text: It is foolish to tear one's hair in grief, as though sorrow would be made less by baldness.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

text: The more sympathy you give, the less you need.
author: Malcolm Forbes

text: Teetotallers lack the sympathy and generosity of men that drink.
author: W. H. Davies

text: I am the son of a small and far-away nation and the other laureates have all come from different countries from all over the world and we all were equally received here with signs of sympathy.
author: Albert Szent-Gyorgyi

text: He bit his lip in a manner which immediately awakened my maternal sympathy, and I helped him bite it.
author: S. J. Perelman

text: Excessive sorrow laughs. Excessive joy weeps.
author: William Blake

text: And whoever walks a furlong without sympathy walks to his own funeral drest in his shroud.
author: Walt Whitman

text: I've always liked Saturn. But I also have some sympathy for Pluto because I heard it's been downgraded from a planet, and I think it should remain a planet. Once you've given something planetary status it's kind of mean to take it away.
author: Jared Leto

text: Reasoned arguments and suggestions which make allowance for the full difficulties of the state of war that exists may help, and will always be listened to with respect and sympathy.
author: Stafford Cripps

text: There's something very beautiful and compelling about someone who has ambition and someone who knows what they want, but it can get a little frustrating at times, so I understand that. I have sympathy for that.
author: Michael Ealy

text: I learnt pity, sympathy, and what it was like to be at the other end of the stick. Such lessons can't be learnt in lecture halls.
author: Lionel Blue

text: I'm in total sympathy with Dick Smith's sentiments I only wish there were grounds for saying we Australians would never tolerate such appalling treatment of refugees being carried out in our name.
author: Hugh Mackay

text: I don't care about sympathy. I care about playing a character who's understandable and clear.
author: Anson Mount

text: Many of the artists who have represented Negro life have seen only the comic, ludicrous side of it, and have lacked sympathy with and appreciation for the warm big heart that dwells within such a rough exterior.
author: Henry Ossawa Tanner

text: Sympathy for victims is always counter-balanced by an equal and opposite feeling of resentment towards them.
author: Ben Elton

text: It is the right of our people to organize to oppose any law and any part of the Constitution with which they are not in sympathy.
author: Alfred E. Smith

text: You don't go around grieving all the time, but the grief is still there and always will be.
author: Nigella Lawson

text: It's hard for me to think of others because I'm not particularly in sympathy with the music of this century.
author: Alan Hovhaness

text: I have sympathy for young people, for their growing pains, but I balk when these growing pains are pushed into the foreground, when you make these young people the only vehicles of life's wisdom.
author: Wislawa Szymborska

text: I'm not going to give a courtesy gift to a person who's going to win, and I'm not going to give a sympathy gift to a person who's going to lose.
author: Tim Kaine

text: I like the Rolling Stones for karaoke. 'Sympathy For The Devil' is a great one.
author: Hugh Jackman

text: Interest does not tie nations together it sometimes separates them. But sympathy and understanding does unite them.
author: Woodrow Wilson

text: When you are sorrowful look again in your heart, and you shall see that in truth you are weeping for that which has been your delight.
author: Khalil Gibran

text: Our sympathy is cold to the relation of distant misery.
author: Edward Gibbon

text: Grief is only the memory of widowed affections.
author: James Martineau

text: Captain Hale, alone, without sympathy or support, save that from above, on the near approach of death asked for a clergyman to attend him. It was refused. He then requested a Bible that too was refused by his inhuman jailer.
author: William Hull

text: It is only after one is in trouble that one realizes how little sympathy and kindness there are in the world.
author: Nellie Bly

text: Truly, it is in darkness that one finds the light, so when we are in sorrow, then this light is nearest of all to us.
author: Meister Eckhart

text: Sorrow is so easy to express and yet so hard to tell.
author: Joni Mitchell

text: If the terrorists have the sympathy of people, it's much harder to find them. So we need people on our side, and that leads us to be responsible leaders of the world, show some concern with the problems.
author: George Soros

text: We should feel sorrow, but not sink under its oppression.
author: Confucius

text: Sympathy with nature is part of a good person's religion.
author: Francis Herbert Hedge

text: I feel sympathy for the working class lad. I've always championed about ticket prices and try to equate that to people's salaries.
author: Alex Ferguson

text: A sorrow's crown of sorrow is remembering happier times.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

text: You will find that the woman who is really kind to dogs is always one who has failed to inspire sympathy in men.
author: Max Beerbohm

text: Tears are the silent language of grief.
author: Voltaire

text: Like many people, most Libertarians feel empathy and sympathy for less fortunate people. But they know you can't have perfection in a world of limited resources.
author: Harry Browne

text: To all those who have suffered as a consequence of our troubled past I extend my sincere thoughts and deep sympathy. With the benefit of historical hindsight we can all see things which we would wish had been done differently or not at all.
author: Queen Elizabeth II

text: Almost all of our sorrows spring out of our relations with other people.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

text: I sometimes get that wonderful sympathy between me and the audience, telling me I've reached their hearts. And when I do, the thrill is mine.
author: Kate Smith

text: The professional must learn to be moved and touched emotionally, yet at the same time stand back objectively: I've seen a lot of damage done by tea and sympathy.
author: Anthony Storr

text: Although I'm Australian, I find myself much more in sympathy with the Austrian version!
author: David Chalmers

text: Any mind that is capable of real sorrow is capable of good.
author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

text: People who drink to drown their sorrow should be told that sorrow knows how to swim.
author: Ann Landers

text: Since this war began our sympathy has gone out to all the suffering people who have been dragged into it. Further hundreds of millions have become involved since I spoke at Limerick fortnight ago.
author: Eamon de Valera

text: I didn't go to university. Didn't even finish A-levels. But I have sympathy for those who did.
author: Terry Prachett

text: The heart forgets its sorrow and ache.
author: James Russell Lowell

text: Okay, so, sometimes in life, I can be a score-keeper - someone who keeps track of what he gives and what he gets in return. An annoying quality, to say the least, and I'm sure my wife has your sympathy, but it's made me highly attuned to when and where credit is due.
author: Mark Feuerstein

text: The true humanist maintains a just balance between sympathy and selection.
author: Irving Babbitt

text: I have to express sympathy from the bottom of my heart to those people who were taken as wartime comfort women. As a human being, I would like to express my sympathies, and also as prime minister of Japan I need to apologize to them.
author: Shinzo Abe

text: I would rather be kept alive in the efficient if cold altruism of a large hospital than expire in a gush of warm sympathy in a small one.
author: Aneurin Bevan

text: I don't really distinguish between sympathy and honesty when I'm writing. The two go together - I'm interested in inhabiting my characters, seeing the world through their eyes.
author: Tom Perrotta

text: When we are out of sympathy with the young, then I think our work in this world is over.
author: George MacDonald

text: Because I select my players from a feeling that comes to me when I am with them, a certain sympathy you might call it, or a vibration that exists between us that convinces me they are right.
author: Erich von Stroheim

text: Life has never been easy. Nor is it meant to be. It is a matter of being joyous in the face of sorrow.
author: Dirk Benedict

text: Remember me with smiles and laughter, for that is how I will remember you all. If you can only remember me with tears, then don't remember me at all.
author: Laura Ingalls Wilder

text: I think loss of loved ones is the hardest blow in life.
author: Marlo Thomas

text: California must be all American or all Chinese. We are resolved that it shall be American, and are prepared to make it so. May we not rely upon your sympathy and assistance?
author: Denis Kearney

text: If we wait until our lives are free from sorrow or difficulty, then we wait forever. And miss the entire point.
author: Dirk Benedict

text: Only by joy and sorrow does a person know anything about themselves and their destiny. They learn what to do and what to avoid.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: All sympathy not consistent with acknowledged virtue is but disguised selfishness.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

text: In externals we advance with lightening express speed, in modes of thought and sympathy we lumber on in stage-coach fashion.
author: Frances E. Willard

text: Grief changes shape, but it never ends.
author: Keanu Reeves

text: One often calms one's grief by recounting it.
author: Pierre Corneille

text: I very much dislike the intolerance and moralism of many Christians, and feel more sympathy with Honest Doubters than with them.
author: A. N. Wilson

text: I've always thought of acting as more of an exercise in empathy, which is not to be confused with sympathy. You're trying to get inside a certain emotional reality or motivational reality and try to figure out what that's about so you can represent it.
author: Edward Norton

text: My guitar was loud as hell, and I had no sympathy for anybody else.
author: Brownie McGhee

text: Our trials, our sorrows, and our grieves develop us.
author: Orison Swett Marden

text: Sympathy is two hearts tugging at one load.
author: Charles Henry Parkhurst

text: The novelist must look on humanity without partiality or prejudice. His sympathy, like that of the historian, must be unbounded, and untainted by sect or party.
author: Goldwin Smith

text: It's no good being nice and young and naive. There's no good in that at all. You've got to do it all yourself, and you've gotta learn quick. And you can't look for sympathy either.
author: Johnny Rotten

text: It is in our faults and failings, not in our virtues, that we touch each other, and find sympathy. It is in our follies that we are one.
author: Jerome K. Jerome

text: We are living at a time when creeds and ideologies vary and clash. But the gospel of human sympathy is universal and eternal.
author: Samuel Hopkins Adams

text: There's a certain amount of sympathy here for the Bush administration's problem, which is they would like to get rid of Saddam Hussein and they would like to have the Kurds autonomous.
author: Les Aspin

text: Sympathy is charming, but it does not make up for pain.
author: Lillie Langtry

text: I joined the Party definitely in 1923 after having already been in sympathy with it before.
author: Fritz Sauckel

text: We do not learn by inference and deduction and the application of mathematics to philosophy, but by direct intercourse and sympathy.
author: Richard M. Nixon

text: We all have to announce our full solidarity with the struggle of those seeking freedom and justice in Syria, and translate this sympathy into a clear political vision that supports a peaceful transition to a democratic system of rule that reflects the demands of the Syrian people for freedom.
author: Mohammed Morsi

text: The community stagnates without the impulse of the individual. The impulse dies away without the sympathy of the community.
author: William James

text: I will indulge my sorrows, and give way to all the pangs and fury of despair.
author: Joseph Addison

text: There's no greater way to gain an audience's sympathy than by being unfortunate.
author: Seth Green

text: Any relations in a social order will endure, if there is infused into them some of that spirit of human sympathy which qualifies life for immortality.
author: George William Russell

text: Actors who are lovers in real life are often incapable if playing the part of lovers to an audience. It is equally true that sympathy between actors who are not lovers may create a temporary emotion that is perfectly sincere.
author: Ivor Novello

text: When sorrows come, they come not single spies, but in battalions.
author: William Shakespeare

text: There is no grief like the grief that does not speak.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

text: A crowd always thinks with its sympathy, never with its reason.
author: William R. Alger

text: Pity may represent little more than the impersonal concern which prompts the mailing of a check, but true sympathy is the personal concern which demands the giving of one's soul.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

text: I take people very seriously. People are all I take seriously, in fact. Therefore, I have nothing but sympathy for how people behave - and nothing but laughter to console them with.
author: John Irving

text: This sympathy is not translated into force against the British government because it is not like the anti- apartheid movement which had a high profile here and Mandela is a more engaging figure than Yasser Arafat.
author: Tom Paulin

text: Two nations between whom there is no intercourse and no sympathy who are as ignorant of each other's habits, thoughts, and feelings, as if they were dwellers in different zones, or inhabitants of different planets. The rich and the poor.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

text: When you've been raised in care, rap music isn't just about guns and sexism. They're talking about real things you can hang on to, problems of identity that you have sympathy with. It's not just about the music, with rap: when I was in care, it meant a whole lot more than that.
author: Samantha Morton

text: The natural effect of sorrow over the dead is to refine and elevate the mind.
author: Washington Irving

text: Sympathy is something that shouldn't be bestowed upon the Yankees. Apparently it angers them.
author: Bob Feller

text: I don't think it's an incredibly radical premise to try and have sympathy for someone who has made a mistake.
author: Joe Cornish

text: The cure for sorrow is to learn something.
author: Barbara Sher

text: Children, even infants, are capable of sympathy. But only after adolescence are we capable of compassion.
author: Louise J. Kaplan

text: The only cure for grief is action.
author: George Henry Lewes
